page.title: 08WHIMPLE PARISH CHURCH
page.content: Whimple parish church was rebuilt in 1845 with an exception of the tower. The south aisle was then added.At the alter there is a rail which shows that you are entering the most sacred part of the church.There are six bells up in the tower.The lowest bell is the tennor and is the biggest.It weighs 12cwt.The lightest bell is the treble. There is a two manual pipe organ.There are three services every sunday.The average congregation is between 30 and 40.At the eight o'clock service there are usually between twelve and fifteen people.At family service there is usually 30 to 40 people.At matins there is about 20 people.In 200 years there has been 6 rectors in the church.The first rector was William Pinceum.The rector now is Mr Tucker. The rector before him was Henry Robins.Mr Tucker will soon retire.
